intro: Oreopanax gargantae, commonly known as the giant oreopanax, is a striking plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves that can reach up to two meters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
